extendedIngredients.name: cabbage
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 quarts finely shredded cabbage (8 to 12 oz.; see notes)
extendedIngredients.originalName: finely shredded cabbage (8 to 12 oz.; see notes)

extendedIngredients.name: carrots
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup sliced carrots (1/4 in. thick; see notes)
extendedIngredients.originalName: sliced carrots (1/4 in. thick; see notes)

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large clove garlic, peeled and minced

extendedIngredients.name: polish sausage
extendedIngredients.original: 12 ounces linguiça (Portuguese) or Polish sausage, sliced 1/4 inch thick
extendedIngredients.originalName: linguiça (Portuguese) or Polish sausage, sliced 1/4 inch thick

extendedIngredients.name: red-skinned potatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound thin-skinned potatoes (1 1/2 in. wide), scrubbed and quartered
extendedIngredients.originalName: thin-skinned potatoes (1 1/2 in. wide), scrubbed and quartered

extendedIngredients.name: wheat beer
extendedIngredients.original: 1 bottle (12 oz.) wheat beer (hefeweizen; see notes)

title: Sausage and Cabbage Soup
summary: Sausage and Cabbage Soup might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe serves 6 and costs $2.27 per serving. One portion of this dish contains about 15g of protein, 17g of fat, and a total of 349 calories. It will be a hit at your Autumn event. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and dairy free diet. If you have thin-skinned potatoes, allspice, coriander seeds, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 78%. This score is solid. Try Cabbage Sausage Soup, Cabbage Sausage Soup, and Sausage Cabbage Soup for similar recipes.
instructions: In a 5- to 6-quart pan over medium-high heat, stir sausage often until lightly browned, 6 to 8 minutes. Spoon out and discard all but 1 tablespoon fat from pan.                                                                                                 Add onion and garlic to pan; stir often until limp, 3 minutes.                                                                                                 Increase heat to high. Add broth, beer, potatoes, cabbage, carrots, coriander, allspice, and peppercorns (wrap and tie spices in cheesecloth if desired). Cover and bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender to bite, 10 to 15 minutes. Discard spices if wrapped.                                                                                                 Stir in parsley. Ladle soup into bowls. Serve mustard alongside to add to taste.

steps.step: In a 5- to 6-quart pan over medium-high heat, stir sausage often until lightly browned, 6 to 8 minutes. Spoon out and discard all but 1 tablespoon fat from pan.
Add onion and garlic to pan; stir often until limp, 3 minutes.

Add broth, beer, potatoes, cabbage, carrots, coriander, allspice, and peppercorns (wrap and tie spices in cheesecloth if desired). Cover and bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender to bite, 10 to 15 minutes. Discard spices if wrapped.
Stir in parsley. Ladle soup into bowls.
Serve mustard alongside to add to taste.
